alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 25 at 6:25PM CDT until August 25 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND SOUTHWESTERN HARLAN COUNTIES... At 625 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Beaver City to near Logan, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, at 618 PM CDT, a 60 MPH wind gust measured at the Norton Kansas airport. These severe storms will be near... Prairie View around 630 PM CDT. Long Island around 640 PM CDT. Phillipsburg around 650 PM CDT. Woodruff around 655 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
